summary: Hephaestus was the Greek god of many crafts and fire. He was either the son of Zeus and Hera or born only by Hera. Hephaestus was known for his skill as a blacksmith, creating weapons for the gods. Despite his lameness, he was a powerful god, often associated with volcanoes and metalwork. His home was on the island of Lemnos, and he was especially revered in Athens for his role in crafting and industry.
title: Hephaestus
